tip: A black steetview car in South America is almost always Argentina or Uruguay
Italy license plates are more narrow than standard EU plates and have blue strips on both sides
If the sun is in the north, you are likely in the southern hemisphere (and vice versa)
A yellow back license plate with a white front plate is the UK
You may sometimes see green license plates in Norway
If the google car has a roof rack with a section of black tape, you are in Ghana
If you appear in Africa and the google car has a snorkel, you are in Kenya
If you appear in Africa and there looks to be cuts in the sky, you are in Senegal
South Africa has the domain ending .za
The UK and Ireland both drive on the left
India, Japan, Malaysia, Thailand, and Singapore are a few of the Asian countries that drive on the left
South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, and Eswatini all drive on the left
Australia and New Zealand both drive on the left
You will often see a white cross on a sign in Colombia
Israel has yellow license plates
Colombia has yellow license plates
Norway has dotted road lines (further apart than Sweden's)
Sweden has dotted road lines (Closer together than Norway's)
Canada speed signs say 'Maximum', US speed signs say 'Speed Limit'
Nigeria often has a 'follow' car behind the google car (usually a toyota)
Hungary and Bulgaria have quite a bit of winter coverage
Most Italian words end in a vowel
If you appear in Europe and there looks to be cuts in the sky, you are in Albania or Montenegro
Canada with Arrêt on a stop sign is very likely Quebec
If you see Stop and Arrêt on a stop sign, you are likely in New Brunswick
Black and White striped poles are a good indication you are in Peru
The Dominican Republic and Guatemala often have a google car with roof bars
Romania, Hungary, and Poland all have similar concrete poles
The Netherlands and Luxembourg both have yellow license plates in the front and back
Uganda has a wide white Jeep looking google car
